Tag.description: Creates a key-value pair for a specific resource.

Key.description: The name assigned to the tag that you create.

Value.description: Contains one or more values that you assigned to the key name you create.

SftpConnectorTrustedHostKey.description: The public host key for the external server to which you are connecting.

AccessRole.description: Specifies the access role for the connector.

LocalProfileId.description: A unique identifier for the local profile.

PartnerProfileId.description: A unique identifier for the partner profile.

MessageSubject.description: The message subject for this AS2 connector configuration.

Compression.description: Compression setting for this AS2 connector configuration.

EncryptionAlgorithm.description: Encryption algorithm for this AS2 connector configuration.

SigningAlgorithm.description: Signing algorithm for this AS2 connector configuration.

MdnSigningAlgorithm.description: MDN Signing algorithm for this AS2 connector configuration.

MdnResponse.description: MDN Response setting for this AS2 connector configuration.

BasicAuthSecretId.description: ARN or name of the secret in AWS Secrets Manager which contains the credentials for Basic authentication. If empty, Basic authentication is disabled for the AS2 connector

PreserveContentType.description: Specifies whether to use the AWS S3 object content-type as the content-type for the AS2 message.

UserSecretId.description: ARN or name of the secret in AWS Secrets Manager which contains the SFTP user's private keys or passwords.

TrustedHostKeys.description: List of public host keys, for the external server to which you are connecting.

Arn.description: Specifies the unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the connector.

ConnectorId.description: A unique identifier for the connector.

LoggingRole.description: Specifies the logging role for the connector.

ServiceManagedEgressIpAddresses.description: The list of egress IP addresses of this connector. These IP addresses are assigned automatically when you create the connector.

Tags.description: Key-value pairs that can be used to group and search for connectors. Tags are metadata attached to connectors for any purpose.
